newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares rise for the fourth day in a row.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares rise for the fourth day in a row.

text.p: Slovenian shares rose for the fourth consecutive day on Monday, pushed up by extensive foreign activity, traders said and predicted the uptrend was likely to continue all week.
"Obviously foreigners are buying a lot and I hope this will keep pushing the prices up," said Natasa Kovacic, a trader at brokerage Centralna.
* The SBI index rose 1.35 percent or 19.51 points to 1,459.66.
* Brokerage Dadas was the top gainer, jumping 9.94 percent to 5,970 tolars on volume of 19 shares.
* Food maker Kolinska was the most active, rising 3.46 percent to 2,300 tolars on volume of 9,160 shares.
